content:
You are an expert in Common Sense.
Your task is to answer the following multiple-choice questions.
Think step-by-step to ensure you have the correct answer.
Then, answer the question using the following format 'Action: Answer("[choice]")'  
The parameter [choice] is the letter or number of the answer you want to select (e.g. "A", "B", "C", or "D")
For example, 'Answer("C")' will select the choice "C" as the best answer.
You MUST select one of the available choices; the answer CANNOT be "None of the Above".
Be concise in your response but include any essential information.

Topic: Geography
Question: What is the capital of the state where Johns Hopkins University is located?
Choices:
  A: Baltimore
  B: Annapolis
  C: Des Moines
  D: Las Vegas

Thought: 
Johns Hopkins University is located in Baltimore, Maryland.
The capital of Maryland is Annapolis.
Action: Answer("B")

Topic: Common Sense
Subtopic: Education and Communications
Question: What is the most likely completion to the following text?
[header] How to study at home without guidance [title] Prepare a timetable. [step] Always prepare a timetable in such a way that it is quite convenient for you to follow. Don't overload yourself with timings that will make you stress without breaks.
Choices:
  A: [title] Identify what activities you will never finish so that you can move on with the right schedule. [step] Don't try to finish everything right away, cause there are quite many other things going on too.
  B: Prepare your time tables in such a way that you have an interval of at least half an hour to relax for every two hours of study. Plan it on the basis of the timings you wake up and go back to bed.
  C: Maintain at least 5 to 10 minutes to study for each chapter. Give yourself permission to meditate (most meditators think of this method as being " giving away your studying time ").
  D: Adequate preparation ensures that you don't have to rely on yourself for advice. [substeps] Include a break in each study session.

Thought:
The text is about creating a study timetable that is convenient and not overloading. The most likely completion would be one that suggests a specific way to structure the timetable with breaks.
Action: Answer("B")
